He'd never talked to a Congressional candidate. We took a photo. He put up a yard sign. I can't imagine my 18 y/o parents thinking that one day they'd be canvassing in that neighborhood for their daughter, running for Congress. I'm going to remember this day for a long time.

Today out canvassing with my dad, he pointed out a small duplex. He & my mom lived there when they were first married. They were 18 y/o. As I was about to hang literature on the door, the owner came out on his way to work. We told him of our history with the house.
